page.title: 19WHITACRE WATER WORKS
page.content: The original works which were to supply Birmingham with approx 6000000 gallons of water per day, began operating in 1883 when Shustoke Reservoir was completed. In 1904 the Elan Valley Scheme was put into operation to supply Birmingham and Whitacre was put on standby. In 1908 Whitacre Waterworks were used to supply Coventry. Now the water is used for Nuneaton, parts of Atherstone & Bedworth & for about 10% of Coventry's needs. In 1977 the existing works were completed. Further improvements in output are anticipated by the installation of a new pumping station. The sources of water are the River Bourne and the River Blythe. During the 1976 drought the River Cole was used as an additional supply of water.
